newsitem.title: USA: Infinity sells Dallas FM radio station.
newsitem.headline: Infinity sells Dallas FM radio station.

text.p: Infinity Broadcasting Corp said Tuesday it has entered into an agreement to sell its Dallas radio station, KEWS-FM, to Salem Communications Corp.

However, Infinity said it will receive Salem's Dallas radio station, KDFX-AM. To comply with the Federal Communications Commission's AM multiple ownership limits, Infinity will divest its Dallas radio station, KDMM-AM.
The transaction fulfills Infinity's promise to the Federal Communications Commission to divest one of its FM stations in the Dallas market.
The company was complying with FCC regulations that prohibit a company from owning more than five FM stations in the same market.
Infinity said in June that it had entered into an agreement to merge with Westinghouse Electric Corp. The merger is currently in the midst of regulatory review.
Salem Communications is based in Camarillo, Calif.
